name: DXI Routing Table & Priority Handling
title: DXI Routing Table & Priority Handling
body:
Overview

This article provides guidance on where to route issues depending on their type, along with a definition of severity levels, Sev-1 handling and also special handling in some very specific cases.

  • Support Scope
  • Support Eligibility
  • German Special Handling
  • Temp escalation handling
  • External Teams
  • Severity Levels

Support Scope

Module System Description Comments
Projects Management Admin Portal Create and manage Survey module with a graphical interface supporting simple and complex questionnaires​​, triggers, and Org Structure for the project.  
People Management Admin Portal Manage panelist profiles, roles, and access rights. Includes functionalities for onboarding, editing user details, and maintaining organizational hierarchies​​. Enabling features done by CS; Portal creation/customization is done by customer or PS Team.
Websites Configurations Admin Portal Manage customer-facing panel websites via CMS. Includes options for creating additional websites and language versions​​ (Initial setup done by PS Team). Enabling features done by CS; Portal creation/customization is done by customer or PS Team
Websites Usage Website Frontend End-user issues while using websites generated by Websites Configurations module  
Portal Configurations Admin Portal Configure portal settings for end-users to review survey results and statistics. Built through the Admin Portal​​ (Initial setup done by PS Team). Enabling features done by CS; Portal creation/customization is done by customer or PS Team.
Portal Usage Portal Frontend End-user issues while using Portals generated by Portals Configurations module  
Report Manager Admin Portal / DataVoyager Admin Facilitates data export and reporting. Allows the generation of detailed reports and supports multiple formats such as PDF and PPT​​.  
MySight configurations Admin Portal Tableau Server configuration module. Enables the integration and configuration of Tableau dashboards within the DXI environment​​.  
360 EFS Leadership Portals Special personized survey type - Self-service 360 Leadership surveys for leaders to evaluate their performance and gather feedback from others. Includes an HR view for reviewing statistics​​.
This is recently being implemented/replaced using Guides in Portal configurations

If request is from Lufthansa (@lat.dlh.de) or related to https://360feedback.dlh.de/www, analyze if the issue is support-related or PS related.

If CS-related, work the ticket as usual.

If PS-related, close the ticket with a message:

"
Dear <Customer>,

Thank you for contacting Discover Xi Support! We appreciate your reaching out to us.

To ensure you receive the most accurate and prompt assistance, we kindly ask that you direct your inquiry to 360feedback@dlh.de. They are well-equipped to assist you further with your request and will provide the support you need.

Thank you again for your patience and understanding.
 
Best Regards,
<Agent Name>
Discover Xi Support
Access Rights Management Admin Portal Control user access to various modules and functionalities within the DXI environment. Supports role-based access control​​.  
SSO - Identity Providers / OKTA SSO Custom vs OKTA SSO. Integrates with existing SSO infrastructure, using SAML 2.0 or OpenID Connect protocols for authentication. Integrates with OKTA optionally​​. L2 Module activation/initial setup and troubleshooting in EFS instance
Okta -> Eng
Custom -> PS
API Integration APIs REST and SOAP APIs for integrating customer systems with DXI for data import and export. Supports secure and efficient data exchange​​. L2 Module activation/initial setup in EFS instance
Bugs are routed to Eng
Customizations are routed to PS
Tableau Integration Tableau Integrates with Tableau for advanced data visualization and dashboard creation. Enables users to build and customize reports​​. Bugs in customizations are routed to PS
Bugs in Tableau Sync or Core integration are routed to Eng.
Text Analysis API to Azure Cognitive Services Provides tools for text analytics, including sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, and topic detection​​.  Might require API Key generation by L2 Team
Email Notifications Email Services Uses Hurricane MTA for sending transactional emails and survey invitations. Supports customizable email templates and scheduling​​. Investigations on Hurican MTA, by L2 team
SMS Services SMS Services Integrates with services like Tyntec for sending SMS communications within the DXI environment​​. Tyntec Team can be reached via External portal
SFTP SFTP Secure File Transfer Protocol endpoints for data exchange. Onboarding new installations and access requests are through Saas Team
SQL Injection checks Database Customer reports Potential SQL Injection Breach. Initial Troubleshooting for Potential SQL Injection Breach can be done by CS Cyborg Team. If an issue is found, it should be escalated to Eng team
24.2 release   24.2 release is on hold Please respond to the customer with:

Dear <Customer>,
Thank you for reaching out. At this time, 24.2 is on hold as we focus on stabilizing the product and gaining a deeper understanding of its current state. We plan to revisit this in 2025 Q1 and will keep you updated on any progress or changes.
We appreciate your patience and understanding.

Best Regards,
Discover Xi Support


Support Eligibility

Some Unipark installations are not eligible for support (except for licensing issues): Support Eligibility for Unipark Installations 

German Special Handling

Tivian DXi has a large German customer base, and part of this is that some contracts specify that some customers are supposed to receive support in German language ONLY. This means that CS is required to send all responses to the below customers in German (both human and AI responses):

  • CitiBank
  • GlobalPark
  • Payback GmbH
Tickets handled by human agents will have a banner specifying this, and you need to pay attention to this sensitive detail moving forward and make sure you respond in German only to these tickets.

There are, however, some exceptions, as some users of these orgs do NOT speak German (example: 4470201). There is a language override in place for these customers in ATLAS-chat, allowing them to select their language; you will simply need to match their language. Further work will be done to clarify the process.

There are also 2 tags in each ticket that can be used as "reminders" for this German-language bind: dxi_german_contract and  german_support.

As for the AI side of things, Zendesk organizations will be configured in such a way that ATLAS-chat will respond in German to these customers, but it may happen that sometimes a customer account is not assigned to its rightful Zendesk organization, thus resulting in them not receiving German support.

If you ever come across this situation, please make sure that you assign the customer accounts to the rightful organizations in Zendesk.

Temp escalation handling

In the initial days of handling tickets, it is best that we keep track of the escalated tickets, so that they are reviewed by the legacy Tivian team.

Please use Tivian Escalated Tickets - Google Sheets in order to track all DXI escalations for further review, and the Tivian legacy team will review and assist with them.

External Teams

Component Description Handling 
Sales / Account Management

 

Any request related to the account management team, such as licensing, enabling features (ex: SMS module request, portals), contracts, or other arrangements.

Send side conversation to the Account Manager. If you cannot locate the account manager in Salesforce, send to Emin Medic (emin.medic@aurea.com) and Chris Morino (chris.morino@aurea.com).

If request is coming from BU to enable a feature (not from PS), then we shall work on the request directly.
If a request for new/clone installation is coming from non-BU contact, escalate to BU for Sales review
SaaS

 

- Any issues related to the performance or stability of the platform, such as internal server errors.

- Change Requests (ex: Restore Env, Onboarding/Offboarding a customer as per L2 runbook, SFTP access, etc..)

 

Create a Jira ticket under the Tivian - DXI Project following the process in Escalating to Engineering and SaaS Ops
Select the SaaS Incident/CR issue type as needed.

 
Customer Defects

 

Any issue related to a defect within the products. Please use https://zu7544.customervoice360.com/www for reproducing the issues as our test instance is on 24.2 release.

Follow the guidelines mentioned in the document.

 

 

Escalate to Engineering following the standard process, and consider the following Guidelines. 

 

Professional Services

 

This includes the following:

- Full setup or non-trivial modifications for different configurations/customizations (People, Portals, Website, Survey Creation, etc...).
CS scope is enabling features, sharing knowledge, but performing time-consuming configurations on behalf of the customer is out of CS scope.

- Custom SSO Integration

- All Customizations, ex: custom-tailored CSS/JS, Customizations to standard APIs, Report Manager, Tableau dashboards

- Bugs with Customizations which are not caused by core defect (ex: a custom JS issue)

- Tivian Mobile App requests (Obsolete app)

- If 360 portal request is from Lufthansa (@lat.dlh.de) or related to https://360feedback.dlh.de/www

- For Kantar installations, please check Routing Kantar Support Tickets 

- If an error is found (or reported by SAAS) related to the projekte folder, then investigating this error is PS scope, ex:
/nfs/opst/xxxxx.customervoice360.com/projekte/

 

 

CS is responsible for the initial triage and isolation of customer issues to either a customization, or a core functionality defect.
Once isolated away from the core Tivian systems (API, common functionalities, etc...):

 

Escalate to the Professional Services team using the Elevate Ticket to BU (All Brands) Macro and set External Team as BU - PS. 

Also make sure a corresponding Jira ticket is created. If the external team is not set up, kindly de-escalate and re-escalate the ticket to correct it.

 

Contacts for Professional Services are as follows:

  • Communicate XI: Yaswan Aziz email: yaswan.aziz@skyvera.com
  • Discover XI: Christopher Voigt; email: christopher.voigt@skyvera.com

 

Feature Requests

 

 

General requests related to the creation or modification of core code components (requested as a general product enhancement, not a customer specific customization).

Send an SC to omar.ortiz@trilogy.com, noumaan.shah@devfactory.com and christopher.voigt@aurea.com on the request and close the ticket with the following message:

"Thank you for taking the time to submit your feature request! We appreciate your input. I've passed your suggestion along to our VP of Product. We're always looking for ways to improve, and customer feedback like yours is invaluable in that process."

and follow the process for raising FR for Jigsaw BU

 

Compliance

Questions related to compliance, ex: Security concerns, GDPR, Penetration Tests, etc..

Follow the standard Central Compliance process

 

If it is for Payback organization, please raise it to BU and SC.

 

Severity Levels

There are three severity levels assigned to exception reports:

  • Minor: One installation or a not commonly used Service is not available in one environment.

  • Medium: Multiple Installations or a heavily used Service (e.g., Mailing) is not available in one environment.

  • Major: All installations in one environment are not available.

Guidelines to follow while elevating to Engineering

When submitting a ticket, it is important to provide the necessary information so the team can assess and address the issue as quickly as possible. Below are the required fields and guidelines for every ticket.

Important & relevant information: Engineering has NO ACCESS to production or sandbox instances. Also, no 24.2 bugfix is going to be considered as it's deprecated.

 

Required Information

  1. Project File (project.gpx) & Master Data ( View the recording on how to export it) :
    • Attach the relevant project.gpx file, and master data if required, that demonstrates the issue.
    • Ensure that the project file is from the environment where the issue was detected.
  2. Build Number:
    • Provide the build number where the issue was reproduced by Customer Support agent.
    • Format: 24.1.xyz (Ensure it matches the exact version used during testing).
  3. Clear Reproduction Steps:
    • Important: DO NOT use URLs to production installations or customer-specific installations.
    • Outline clear, step-by-step instructions on how to reproduce the issue.
    • Steps should be described in detail with expected and actual results.
    • A video is worth millions of words.
  4. Logs (If Applicable):
    • Attach any relevant logs that could help diagnose the issue (e.g., server logs, browser console output).
  5. Screenshots or Videos:
    • If applicable, provide screenshots or videos demonstrating the issue.
